answerText: Santiago [10] Santiago is the title character of this Ernest Hemingway work, which describes his attempt to catch some big marlin.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | University of Pittsburgh A and Walter Johnson High School | 4 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This character claims to be eating a pot of yellow rice with fish for dinner everyday, and he dreams of lions on the beach.  [10] Name this DiMaggio-loving character who worked with Manolin during an eighty-seven day run of bad luck.
